content.description: Sit start on a low horizontal jug. Move up the crimpy and very fine textured face to top out.
content.protection: One pad and a spotter to keep you from falling back into the Front boulder.
content.location: The problem directly opposite the Descent Slab on the Front boulder. When you walk up to the first boulder, keep it on your left side until you come to the narrow squeeze between it and the Makaia boulder. Zealot is on your right side. Just big enough to fit one pad in the path.

content.description: Start sitting on a downed tree at the left side of the slightly overhung triangular face. Traverse up and right along the arete with some seams to top out on the horn at the apex.
content.location: The backside of the Makaia boulder.

content.description: Start on a good flake at the far left side of the back of the Makaia boulder. Traverse right all the way to the apex of the slightly overhanging part of this face. Top out above to horn.
content.protection: One pad would be fine, but a spotter would need to be dragging it.
content.location: The chest height flake of the far left side of the face that has a low sloping ledge that starts five feet to the right.

content.description: Sit start on overhanging jugs. Climb up to a tricky top out on the sometimes dirty slab.
content.location: The overhang that is to the right of the Front boulder.

content.description: Start to the right of Makaia as far as you can go before it gets too dirty and traverse left on crimps and finish Makaia. Great for warming up.
Start standing with hands matched high on a flake. Make just a couple moves up and left to top out.
content.protection: One pad for the climb, but having a couple stacked just to reach the starting hold may be nice for shorter people.
content.location: Of the two climbs on the backside of the Makaia boulder, this is the one on the right.

content.description: Start right hand on the arete and left hand on the horn very low by feet. Climb to the arete and top out at peak where it meets Rebar.
content.location: Found on Makaia to the right of Rebar.

content.description: Start at the good rail ~6 feet off the ground up and to the left of the obvious start for Zealot. Using high feet, make a big confident move to the right-hand sidepull jug. Walk your feet up for the easy topout.
content.location: Just to the left of Zealot in the gap between the slab

content.description: This boulder has a good number of quality problems on it, each differing greatly in style. It has the easy overhang of Makaia's Problem, the tricky sit start to Zealot, the traverse of Rebar, and two taller climbs on the backside of the boulder.
